intro: Chiococca brachiata var. rigidula, commonly known as the rigid stem chiococca, is a climbing vine native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
